content: a different size and will use a different amount of yarn how to make a different size adjusting the size of the happy potholder is easy here are a few different ways to do it change the width increase or decrease the number of stitches in the foundation chain and subsequent row in groups of 3 or change the height increase or decrease the number of row or change the width and height change the size of the yarn and/or crochet hook what you ll need to make the happy potholder you will need £ 3 colours x 50g balls of homelea happy merino wool yarn this will make 2 potholders or 100m 109yds of a 10ply / worsted weight yarn £ 4 00mm g crochet hook £ scissors £ tape measure or ruler £ darning needle £ 2 stitch markers £ wool detergent and towel for wet blocking at the end £ the desire to make something beautiful about the yarn homelea happy is made from soft merino wool that is fully grown and processed in australia with no overseas processing it s uncommon for an australian wool yarn to not have some overseas processing it feels soft woolly and comfortable it s slightly thick and thin which makes it a textural joy to crochet with homelea happy is a 10ply / worsted weight that comes in 50g balls with 100m / 109yds in each ball 3 happy potholder uk and us terminology v1 2 a homelea lass® crochet pattern ©homelea lass 2023 #homelealass homelealass com colour inspiration it s nice to know here are some tips to make your crocheting easier to stop the yarns from getting tangled only unwind a short length and rearrange the balls of yarn at the start of each row take your time with the first 4 row to understand which stitches to do and where as well as how to carry the yarn up the sides i ve broken up the pattern for each row into start middle and end so it s easier to understand how the colours are carried up the sides during the pattern i use some names for the different yarn colours here are the names and what they mean o current row colour this is the colour of the row you re currently crocheting o previous row colour this is the colour waiting at the start or end of the row it will be different at the start and end of the row it s the colour used either 1 or 2 row below you can use the wet blocking instructions when you wash the potholder and just in case the colours run don t soak it for too long i ve selected the crochet hook size so that the potholder is firm and ready to be use with hot things if you want a more drapey potholder then use a larger crochet hook if you re using a different yarn and you think it might be
